intro: Elattostachys goropuensis, commonly known as the Goropu grass, is a member of the Poaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and forest margins, thriving in well-drained soils. Its morphology includes slender stems and narrow leaves, typical of many grass species. Elattostachys goropuensis plays a role in local ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for small fauna.
